author: OKFN
name: rwanda-dad
notes:
Database of development aid assistance to Rwanda

## Details
The Development Assistance Database for Rwanda (DAD – Rwanda ) application is an aid management solution promoting good governance and public accountability and transparency. It is an automated information management system which is designed to improve efficiency and coordination of donor activities within the country. It is also a powerful tool for tracking and analyzing aid flows. The system serves as the main database and data collection and reporting system for the donor and NGO community as it ensures effective access to aid data. 

The Development Assistance Database (DAD) is the most widely implemented solution for Aid Management, Public Investment and National Budgeting. It has been established in more than 25 countries world-wide in close cooperation with UNDP and respective governments to promote transparency and accountability of funds, results-driven decision-making, and aid effectiveness.

extras.value:
Only accessable through Internet Explorer. Page can be viewed in French or English.

Easiest navigation of projects on "list" page and then go to "modify current view" (top right). Doesn't seem to be a way of exporting from this. To export go to "Report" and select the row and column headings required for the report. This is time consuming if you want to extract multiple fields. Can also plot graphs and search the country by region.
In theory, but need to select each column heading one at a time. Very time consuming
Many project profiles incomplete or with limited information

Title, Description, Program, Using Parallel PIU?, Approval Date, Start Date, End Date, Duration, Implementation Status, Sectors, Is this a multi-coutry project?, Locations, Donor Agencies, Implementers, National Counterpart Agencies, Relevant Project Contacts, Project Cost Amount requested for the project implementation, Commitments and Disbursements (with dates), Activities, Notes / Comments, Project Missions, Analytic Works, Other Attachments, User Activity Log

No real information on how the data is sourced. Only says that data can be entered on the site, but no info on who is responsible for data entry or if the data is checked.

ODA information currently available in DAD Rwanda is under revision and data cleaning. Until further notice the data should be considered provisional.
User guide from "help" at top right of screen
